articles.headline: Choke Point of a Nation: The High Cost of an Aging River Lock
articles.snippet: A symbol of America’s ailing infrastructure, Lock No. 52 on the Ohio River is responsible for a shipping bottleneck that hobbles commerce far and wide.
articles.abstract: A symbol of America’s ailing infrastructure, Lock No. 52 on the Ohio River is responsible for a shipping bottleneck that hobbles commerce far and wide.
articles.lead_paragraph: Luther Helland stood on a platform in the middle of the river and surveyed his dam. It was in bad shape. Several of the panels that kept the water back were missing, while others were out of true. Weeks of work stretched before him, compounded by the vagaries of the river.

articles.headline: Nikki Haley’s Path: From Daughter of Immigrants to Trump’s Pick for U.N.
articles.snippet: Ms. Haley, the governor of South Carolina, once criticized President-elect Donald J. Trump’s demeanor, but is now his choice for United Nations ambassador.
articles.abstract: Ms. Haley, the governor of South Carolina, once criticized President-elect Donald J. Trump’s demeanor, but is now his choice for United Nations ambassador.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — Gov. Nikki R. Haley of South Carolina is the daughter of immigrants, favors free markets and global trade, and earned international attention for speaking out against the Confederate battle flag in the aftermath of the 2015 massacre at a black church in Charleston. During Donald J. Trump’s presidential campaign, she sharply criticized his demeanor and warned what it might mean for American diplomacy — even suggesting that his tendency to lash out at critics could cause a world war.
articles.byline: By Richard Fausset and Somini Sengupta

articles.headline: Mortgage Rates’ Rise Catches Home Buyers — and Lenders — Off Guard
articles.snippet: Since the election, rates have climbed roughly half a percentage point, adding hundreds, sometimes thousands, of dollars to a buyer’s yearly payments.
articles.abstract: Since the election, rates have climbed roughly half a percentage point, adding hundreds, sometimes thousands, of dollars to a buyer’s yearly payments.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Jared Rutledge called his mortgage broker one morning last week after putting in an offer on a home in Glendale, Ariz., just west of Phoenix, he discovered that the 3.8 percent rate he had been quoted a couple of months ago had already gone up to 4.125 percent. That afternoon, it had inched up to 4.25, and by evening, when he finally called back to finalize the deal, it was 4.375 percent.
articles.byline: By Patricia Cohen and Conor Dougherty

articles.headline: A Less Frenzied Black Friday as Millennials Opt to Stay In
articles.snippet: Millennials go online for their shopping, leaving a somewhat older crowd at the stores. Discounters like dollar stores may benefit.
articles.abstract: Millennials go online for their shopping, leaving a somewhat older crowd at the stores. Discounters like dollar stores may benefit.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you’re in the retail business in the United States, you probably really care about these two things: millennials and Black Friday.

articles.headline: Overtime Rule Is but the Latest Obama Initiative to End in Texas Court
articles.snippet: In the last two years, federal judges in Texas have chipped away at President Obama’s legacy by striking down or suspending no fewer than five regulations and executive orders.
articles.abstract: In the last two years, federal judges in Texas have chipped away at President Obama’s legacy by striking down or suspending no fewer than five regulations and executive orders.
articles.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump promised to undo many of the Obama administration’s most ambitious regulations. But even before he takes office, federal courts in Texas are doing some of the work for him.
articles.byline: By Noam Scheiber and Barry Meier

articles.headline: Betsy DeVos, Trump’s Education Pick, Has Steered Money From Public Schools
articles.snippet: Ms. DeVos, a philanthropist, activist and Republican fund-raiser, has worked to give families vouchers to attend private schools and pressed to expand charter schools.
articles.abstract: Ms. DeVos, a philanthropist, activist and Republican fund-raiser, has worked to give families vouchers to attend private schools and pressed to expand charter schools.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is hard to find anyone more passionate about the idea of steering public dollars away from traditional public schools than Betsy DeVos, Donald J. Trump’s pick as the cabinet secretary overseeing the nation’s education system.

articles.headline: Iraq Told Civilians to Stay in Mosul. Now They’re Paying With Their Lives.
articles.snippet: With more and more civilians caught up in the battle to take Mosul from the Islamic State, some military officials are second-guessing their initial strategy.
articles.abstract: With more and more civilians caught up in the battle to take Mosul from the Islamic State, some military officials are second-guessing their initial strategy.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSUL, Iraq — By the time little Amira, just a year old, reached the field clinic near the front line in Mosul, she was already dead. All her father could do was bundle her up in a golden blanket, carry her to a nearby mosque and bury her.

articles.headline: Has a Start-Up Found the Secret to Farming the Elusive Truffle?
articles.snippet: The American Truffle Company has a new technique that it says can expand the range of the Perigord truffle in North America, but success is proving costly.
articles.abstract: The American Truffle Company has a new technique that it says can expand the range of the Perigord truffle in North America, but success is proving costly.
articles.lead_paragraph: NAPA, Calif. — Gig the truffle dog zigzags with her nose to the ground among hundreds of oak and filbert trees. Her goal is to sniff out the Perigord truffle, a fungus so prized by chefs it is called the diamond in the kitchen.

articles.headline: In the Chamber of Secrets: J.K. Rowling’s Net Worth
articles.snippet: The author’s wealth is a closely guarded secret, but she is most likely a billionaire. She’s also a role model, and no one seems to resent her success.
articles.abstract: The author’s wealth is a closely guarded secret, but she is most likely a billionaire. She’s also a role model, and no one seems to resent her success.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2012, Forbes dropped J. K. Rowling after eight years on its authoritative billionaires list, saying high British taxes and large charitable contributions had eroded her fortune.

articles.headline: One Money Question to Rule Them All: How Much Is Enough?
articles.snippet: We can get an idea of what to us feels like enough money by getting a baseline on spending and quantity, then homing in on quality.
articles.abstract: We can get an idea of what to us feels like enough money by getting a baseline on spending and quantity, then homing in on quality.
articles.lead_paragraph: As we enter this season of contemplation and reflection, we all have more than the usual number of everyday financial questions weighing on us.
